title: Game takes ages to open up post game chat
body: When finishing a match, chatting with others is essentially impossible for me because it takes close to a minute at worst to open up the post game chat. By the time I get in, everyone has already left besides the one or two people that afk in the post screen after the match. If this is intentional to stop people for carrying on fights into the post game, why?

replies.body:
I was having the same issue.  
Switched back to legacy client and haven't had a problem since.

Edit: (From 7.6 Patch Notes)

> Enabling Low-Spec Mode kills the client while you're in-game, boosting your in-game machine performance but adding to the time it takes to get to the end-of-game screen (since the process has to automatically reboot the client). Based on player feedback, weâ€™re working on making this an optional toggle in the settings so you can enable Low-Spec mode without killing the client in the background (or vice versa).

So, previous to this patch, with the updated client you either;
A: Run in normal mode and end up joining pre-game lobbies late.
B: Run in low spec mode and end up joining post-game lobbies late.

If the after match lobby is taking awhile to load up, there's a good chance that your network is having a hard time reconnecting to the game client after the match. After a match, your network disconnects from the individual game server and reconnects to the normal client servers. If there is a delay here, that would explain the slow post game chat. 

Let's first go through our [Connection Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to be sure that your network is keeping a stable connection throughout the whole game process.
